intro: Echites cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno echis, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and poorly understood species.
